title: QCT (Quanta Cloud Technology) Pioneers Hyper-Converged Infrastructure in Collaboration with VMware EVO SDDC
text:
Multiple Integrated Systems Available at QCT’s Global Cloud Solution Centers to Demonstrate Its Leadership in Fast-Growing SDDC Space
SAN FRANCISCO, CA
VMWORLD // Hyper-converged infrastructure—a cloud architecture that tightly integrates compute, storage, networking and virtualization resources in a rack supported by one vendor—are taking center stage for QCT (Quanta Cloud Technology) at this week’s VMworld® 2015 US event at San Francisco’s Moscone Center.
QCT will showcase its collaboration with VMware to develop the VMware EVO SDDC hyper-converged infrastructure at the event.
QCT is a global data center solution provider and a pioneer in hyper-converged infrastructure. The company is extending its leadership in hyperscale data centers into the enterprise private cloud and hybrid cloud space.
QCT will offer a standard 19” rack, with QCT QuantaGrid D51B server and QCT QuantaMesh BMS series switches, powered by VMware EVO SDDC.. The two companies are also working together on an OCP (Open Compute Project) specification. At VMworld 2015 US, visitors can find QCT at booth #747 and in the Hyper-Converged Infrastructure Zone.
Mike Yang, general manager of QCT said, “We’ve built a close, collaborative relationship with VMware. Our work together has touched every aspect of the cloud data center, bringing the power of software-defined data center through hyper-converged infrastructure to customers of many sizes, not just the hyperscale players. The relationship between VMware and Quanta provides our mutual customers with new solutions optimized for different applications, workloads and business objectives.”
In addition to showcasing VMware EVO SDDC, QCT will have its Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) Series solution on display. These products, based on VMware technologies, are optimized for a diversity of VDI use cases. The VDI Series includes three configurations:
1. VDIBlock G2, a hyper-converged appliance with the QCT STRATOS S910-X31E microserver. This 3U, nine-node high density microserver is energy efficient and comes bundled with VMware Virtual SAN technology, leveraging direct-attached storage resources to drive down storage costs for office desktop workloads.
2. VMBlock is a hyper-converged infrastructure solution with the QCT QuantaPlex T41S-2U , designed with flexible configuration in hardware and available for various software modules. VMBlock is appropriate for versatile workloads including VDI and hybrid cloud environment.
3. VDIBlock 3D Advance is the result of a three-way collaboration among QCT, VMware and NVIDIA. The solution enables easy scale-out of performance and capacity for the most demanding 3D applications and use cases in VDI environment, especially for graphic intensive applications such as AutoCAD, PTC Creo.
About QCT
QCT (Quanta Cloud Technology) is a global datacenter solution provider extending the power of hyperscale datacenter design in standard and open SKUs to all datacenter customers. Product lines include servers, storage, network switches, integrated rack systems and cloud solutions, all delivering hyperscale efficiency, scalability, reliability, manageability, serviceability and optimized performance for each workload. QCT offers a full spectrum of datacenter products and services from engineering, integration and optimization to global supply chain support, all under one roof. The parent of QCT is Quanta Computer, Inc., a Fortune Global 500 technology engineering and manufacturing company. http://www.QuantaQCT.com
